metadata.title: CVE-2016-3191 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The compile_branch function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE 8.x before 8.39 andpcre2_compile.c in PCRE2 before 10.22 mishandles patterns containing an(*ACCEPT) substring in conjunction with nested parentheses, which allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(stack-based buffer overflow) via a crafted regular expression, asdemonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror, akaZDI-CAN-3542.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcre3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.38-3
pcregrep - 2:8.38-3
No subscription required

libpcre2-16-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-32-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-8-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-posix0 - 10.31-2
pcre2-utils - 10.31-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.38-3').
pcre2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.31-2').
